newsitem.title: USA: Canada spot natgas eases in West ahead of weekend.
newsitem.headline: Canada spot natgas eases in West ahead of weekend.

text.p: Canadian spot natgas prices in the West turned marginally softer Friday ahead of lower weekend demand, market sources said.
Spot gas at the AECO storage hub in Alberta was discussed about one to two cents lower at C$1.90 per gigajoule (GJ) in sluggish trade.
June AECO was quoted at C$1.85-1.87, while June/October was about C$1.83-1.835.
Canadian Gas Association said Friday that western gas stocks as of April 25 were at 48.96 bcf, or 18.9 percent full. This compares with 31.8 percent full a year ago.
